title: the first skeletons of this race were discovered in 1868
Leonardo da Vinci sketches details of a rudimentary mechanical calculator
The Spanish Armada comes to visit England (they were soon to regret it!
John Napier invents a simple multiplication table called Napier’s Bones

note: William Oughtred invents the slide rule (based on John Napier’s Logarithms).
An Illustrated History of Electronics and Computing ■ 3
title: Wilhelm Schickard invents the first mechanical calculator
Charles Babbage conceives the first mechanical computer, the Analytical Engine
Joseph Henry discovers self-induction or inductance
Michael Faraday defines the laws of electrolysis
Samuel Finley Breese Morse exhibits an electric telegraph

container-title: An Illustrated History of Electronics and Computing ■ 9
title: Sir Charles Wheatstone and Sir William Fothergill Cooke patent the five-needle electric telegraph

George Boole publishes his first ideas on symbolic logic
Francis Galton invents the Teletype printer
The paper bag is invented
Jean Foucault invents the first gyroscope
Sir Charles Tilston Bright lays the first deepwater cable between Scotland and Ireland
Telegraph used in the Crimea War
James Clerk Maxwell explains Faraday’s lines of force using mathematics
Heinrich Geissler invents a powerful vacuum pump
Cunard agents in New York send first commercial telegraph message to report a collision between two steam ships

container-title: An Illustrated History of Electronics and Computing ■
title: First transatlantic telegraph cable is laid (and later failed

First simultaneous transmission from both ends of a telegraph wire
James Clerk Maxwell describes the electromagnetic nature of light and publishes his theory of radio waves
Alexander Graham Bell conceives the idea of the telephone
Edison invents the Mimeograph

container-title: An Illustrated History of Electronics and Computing ■
title: James Clerk Maxwell states that atoms must have a structure
Intelligible human speech heard over Alexander Graham Bell’s telephone for the first time
Alexander Graham Bell patents the telephone
First commercial telephone service goes into operation
Thomas Watson devises a “thumper” to alert users of incoming telephone calls
First public long-distance telephone lines between Boston and
Sir Joseph Wilson Swan demonstrates a true incandescent light bulb

Denis Redmond demonstrates capturing an image using selenium photocells

container-title: An Illustrated History of Electronics and Computing ■
title: Thomas Alva Edison invents an incandescent light bulb (a year after Sir Joseph Wilson Swan in England
William Hammer and Thomas Alva Edison discover the “Edison Effect
Paul Gottleib Nipkow uses spinning disks to scan, transmit, and reproduce images
Reverend Charles Lutwidge Dodgson (Lewis Carroll) publishes a diagrammatic technique for logic representation in The Game of Logic

container-title: An Illustrated History of Electronics and Computing ■ 19
title: Thomson discovers the electron
Alexander Popov (also spelled Popoff) constructs a receiver for natural electricity waves and tries to detect thunderstorms
Guglielmo Marconi transmits a Morse code message “let it be so” across the Bristol Channel
Marconi establishes the first Marconi-station at the Needles (Isle of Wight, England), sending a signal over 22 km to the English coast

container-title: An Illustrated History of Electronics and Computing ■ 23
title: Hubert Booth (or Bothe) invents the first vacuum cleaner
Marconi sends a radio signal across the Atlantic

Transpacific cable links Canada and Australia
US Navy installs radiotelephones aboard ships
John Ambrose Fleming invents the vacuum tube diode rectifier
First practical photoelectric cell is developed
First ultraviolet lamps are introduced

Dunwoody and Pickard build a crystal-and-cat-whisker-radio
First tungsten-filament lamps are introduced

title: Lee de Forest creates a three-element vacuum tube amplifier (the triode
: Lee de Forest begins regular radio music broadcasts

Leo Baekeland patterns an artificial plastic that he calls Bakelite
Marconi shares Nobel prize in physics for his contribution to telegraphy
People can dial their own telephone numbers

The concept of flip-flop (memory) circuits is invented

Czech author Karal Capek coins the term robot in his play R.U.R
Dr Julius Edgar Lilienfield from New York files a patent for what we would now recognize as an npn junction transistor being used in the role of an amplifier

title: John Logie Baird demonstrates an electromechanical TV system
